A relatively new financial instrument, it has high risks, but due to the strong price dynamics, it makes it possible to increase the invested funds due to the difference between the purchase price and the sale price.

The Forex market is an international currency market, considered one of the largest and most active financial markets in the world. Trading on this market is conducted on the basis of currency pairs, both popular (EUR/USD) and more exotic, for example, USD/HKD.

Stock indices are relative indicators that reflect the general state of a country, an industry as a whole, or individual specific investment portfolios. Stock indices characterize the average value of various securities and reveal the overall dynamics.

Digital money does not imply long-term investments and returns from divergences. The only way to make money on cryptocurrency is to buy cheaper and sell more expensive. The instrument is risky and rather auxiliary, it is difficult to predict the price dynamics, but, under favorable circumstances, the profit may exceed all other fundamental instruments for investment.

It is most expedient to invest free funds in cryptocurrency, in the opposite case, it is better to choose more predictable instruments.
Read more about the trading conditions

Here you can learn more about some order parameters, such as: lot volume, leverage, Swap, Spread, Margin Call and Stop Out level, and many others. Competent analysis and forecasting of these indicators will help to significantly increase your profit from trading operations.

An online trader's calculator is a instrument that is used to determine the level of available funds for a planned transaction, as well as to calculate the amount of commission. To use the calculator, you must specify the initial parameters.

Instrument:
specify the selected financial instrument from the list

Price:
specify the estimated price of opening and closing the order to see the possible result

Trade volume:
specify exact trade volume in lots

Swap in points:
calculated automatically based on the difference between Ask and Bid prices

Swap in USD:
calculated automatically based on the cost of position rollover at night

Margin:
the specified data is the minimum amount of free deposit required to make a transaction

Profit:
indication of probable profit based on current parameters

Company Name's brokerage activity is regulated by many strict regulators of international trade
The Australian Financial Regulator. The purpose of this regulator is to ensure control over the fair conditions of the brokerage companies ' activities.
Dubai Financial Regulation and Supervision Authority. This regulator monitors the activities of international financial centers in the territory of the emirate.
The European Securities Market Supervision Authority. This regulator controls financial activities on the territory of the European Union.
The Financial Services Authority of South Africa. The regulator monitors financial transactions in South Africa.
The Financial Regulation and Supervision Authority of the United Kingdom.
Cyprus Securities and Exchange Commission. Performs the regulation of the activities of financial companies in the country.
The Belize International Financial Services Commission.
